body.p: Identify which plasma protein is being described by each statement:
does not originate from the liver.
makes up 60% of the plasma proteins.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Albumin does originate from the liver.
Incorrect. Fibrinogen does originate from the liver.
Incorrect. Alpha globulin does originate from the liver.
Correct. Gamma globulins originate from the lymphocytes.

part.hint: The liver secretes proteins responsible for clotting and colloid osmotic balance.
This protein participates in the immune response.

response.feedback: Correct. Albumin makes up 60% of the plasma proteins.
Incorrect. Fibrinogen makes up about 4% of the plasma proteins.
Incorrect. The globulins combined make up only 36% of plasma proteins.
Incorrect. The globulins combined make up only 36% of plasma proteins.
Incorrect. Albumin maintains colloid osmotic pressure.
Correct. Fibrinogen works with platelets to form blood clots.
Incorrect. Alpha globulins assist with lipid transportation.
Incorrect. Gamma Globulins function help provide immunity.

part.hint: This protein is responsible for clotting and only makes up 4% of the plasma proteins.
It is in an inactive form; its active form is Fibrin.
